parse.title: List of flags of the Papacy

text.*:
This article relies largely or entirely on a single source. Relevant discussion may be found on the talk page. Please help improve this article by introducing citations to additional sources. (June 2013)

The following is a list of flags used in Vatican City and the Papal States.

Contents

  • 1 National flag and State flag
  • 2 Papal flags
  • 3 Military flag
  • 4 Historical flags
  • 5 See also
  • 6 References

National flag and State flag[edit]

Main article: Flag of Vatican City
Flag Date Use Description
June 8, 1929–present National flag and civil ensign Two fields divided vertically, yellow field on the staff side and a white field on the other side, which bears the tiara and the keys. Ratio: 1:1.

Papal flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
2005–2013 Papal pennant With a yellow band at the hoist and Pope Benedict's personal arms in color in the white fly.

Military flag[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
2013–present Swiss Guard Papal guard flag of 1914, but with the arms of Pope Francis and Commandant Christoph Graf

Historical flags[edit]

Flag Date Use Description
1669–1771 Flag with Christ in the cross, St Peter and St Paul.
1771-? Red flag bearing a cross over a stone (near the hoist) and a bear (looking to hoist) at fly.
?-1808 [1] Red and yellow; two colors traditional of the Roman Senate and People.[1] Similar colors as the modern flag of the City of Rome.
1808–1929 Yellow and white.
Former naval ensign White flag with a version of the coat of arms of the Holy See between the figures of Saint Peter and Saint Paul.

See also[edit]

Wikimedia Commons has media related to Flags of the Vatican City.
  • Flag of the Vatican City
  • Coat of arms of the Vatican City

References[edit]

  1. ^ a b "Bandiera pontificia" (in Italian). Stato della cità del Vaticano. Archived from the original on 2008-10-15. Retrieved 2008-07-09. Anticamente la bandiera dello Stato pontificio era giallorossa (o per meglio dire amaranto e rossa, colori derivati dai colori dello stemma della Santa Sede), i due colori tradizionali del Senato e del Popolo romano, che vennero tuttavia sostituiti con il bianco e il giallo nel 1808, allorché Pio VII
